participants: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message:
Hey folks! BofA is asking for some details on our OCR engine and I'm wondering if there any existing resources I can pull from to address the areas highlighted below:
> *High-level description of the methodology* (no need for mathematical details. If these are standard approaches, only the name of the method (ANNs/CNNs, SVM, etc.) is sufficient. Further details can be provided later during the Full Approval model validation.)
Let me know if you know of anything!
@Ted might have something standard we’ve used in the past, this question has almost certainly been asked before.

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: I've found this but I dont see much on OCR. https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/MI/pages/128614436/MINT+FAQ+For+External+Use
Hi Georgia, are they looking for information about Abbyy or Microsoft's OCR engine, or by OCR do they really mean our broader pipeline? Answer will be different depending on what they mean by "OCR"

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: @Ted they plan to use Abbyy for now and MSFT later so I think they would like general information for "OCR" delivered by instabase regardless of provider.
@georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire I'm happy to write up a blurb for you along those lines. Is there a preferred place I should put it so that it's easy to find next time around?

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: I think in the MINT space with the ML/AI info would be great. I have to send something to BofA my tmrw morning so anything quick would be helpful
No problem. Will send you a draft in ~10 minutes. Hammering it out now.

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: thank you so much!!
Thank YOU for all the amazing work on BoA!!!!!

@georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire here is a draft. Let me know if you want me to revise it in a slightly different direction. It's down at the bottom.

https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/MI/pages/128614436/MINT+FAQ+For+External+Use

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: @Ted I think this looks great!

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: Thank you! This is a great starting point.

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: Hey @Ted this documentation worked but now they are requesting any info we have from Abbyy or MSFT on their OCR models. Do we have this info anywhere?
My suspicion is that detailed information on their inner workings is relatively sparse since they’re both commercial products.

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message:
This is what they have detailed:
> *3.1 Model Framework and Theory*
> o    _Bullet points below provide more information on what to address_
> *3.3 Assumptions and Limitations*
> o    _Bullet points below provide more information on what to address_
@Aaron Tami @Matt do you know if we have any official materials on these topics from Abbyy & Microsoft?
are you asking for details about how they are implemented?
i don't think we have much information on that. I can look more into it tho.

Yeah, details on the implementation.

We could certainly write something that sounded nice, containing educated assumptions about third-party code. But ultimately they'd just be assumptions unless there are official materials.
Why do they want these details?

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: They need these details in order to use Abbyy or MSFT ocr in production

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: They need to share with the governance team
